sentences: Lapsed suudavad hästi eesti keelt rääkida.
context: The word 'suudavad' is the 3rd person plural present form of the Estonian verb 'suda', which means 'to be able to' or 'to manage'. It indicates that someone or something has the capability, skill, or permission to do something. In English, it corresponds to 'can' or 'are able to' in the third person plural (they/we formal).
